website_summaries.verdict: Easy-to-install magnetic lights offer quick towing and a flexible lighting solution.
pros: 55-pound magnetized bases secure lights to metal trailer surfaces
Bases feature a protective label, so they won’t scratch the trailer
Double-sided lights with red brake lights on one side and amber flashers on the other
cons: Incandescent lights leave these dimmer than other options
Some reports of turn signals not working properly

customer_reviews.title: Great magnetic mount towing lights
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased a new car to tow behind my motorhome. I had only a few days to get prepared before hitting the road on an extended trip. So, without time to wire into the vehicle's actual tail-light system, these external mount lights did the trick. They are easy to set in place, the magnets hold them tight (past 70mph with no problems) and they are easy to see from the front (amber) and the rear (red).
customer_reviews.author: D. Rambow

customer_reviews.title: Was exactly what I needed and works as described
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this to go on a "toad" behind the RV. The only mod I made was to put a homemade wire cover over all of the connecting wire so as not to mare or mark the vehicle paint. Works great. To make it "fool proof" I marked the right lamp so figuring out which one goes on which side is a no brainer (their instructions are clear but I marking made it REAL easy. Have used it twice so far on two trips and had no issues. The magnets hold and do not slip.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: These Lights are GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: I have a camper trailer but don't have a tow package on my Volvo so I needed some magnetic lights to clip into my four pin adapter. These lights did the job! They're double sided so you can either use the red lights or the orange lights. I used the red side when pulling my camper. They do left turn signal, right turn signal, brake lights, flashers, and "running lights" when plugged in. We reached speed of 65 mph on the interstate and they never moved. They were mounted to metal on the back so I think that was the biggest issue other reviewers were having. They don't know metal from other materials. Try them for yourself. They're great.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah O'Hara

customer_reviews.title: Great accessary for my motorcycle tow hitch carrier
customer_reviews.text: I have a motorcycle tow hitch carrier so that I can carry my motorcycle on the back of my Jeep. Problem is, the motorcycle covers all of my taillights on my Jeep. I bought this towing light kit so that I could place the lights on the carrier. Magnets are strong, cable connections were perfect, and the lights are very visible for cars following me. The lights, brake lights, and turn signals work as expected. I'm legal now, and safe.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Bernard

customer_reviews.title: Great for our Row Boat
customer_reviews.text: Lights work great. Plenty of wire. Only issue is that the magnets aren't strong enough to hold during travel. We zip tied it on after losing the first pair. Lesson learned. ***Update: The customer service from this company is outstanding. After seeing my review they reached out to me and sent me free replacements. Thank you!***
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Strong magnetic lights that work well
customer_reviews.text: I was borrowing a neigbor’s 6’ trailer for some running that didn’t have lights, so I looked and found these to avoid getting pulled over. The magnets are strong enough to keep the lights from moving at all, but do release easily enough when you pull on them. They come with plenty of cable length and include an extra strand and press connectors if you needed more. The lights where bright and visible. They are Amber one one side and red on the other. I can’t speak to longevity as they have been on there for only a couple months but they still work fine as of now. Overall I would buy them again for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Works as you would expect.
customer_reviews.text: The magnet to hold the light on is subjectively stronger than others have reported in my opinion. Having said that, I still chose to put a few turns of duct tape around the light since I did not like the image in my head of what happens if one falls loose. The quality of construction is better than I expected, the wires and plug as good as a permanent unit, and it worked. At twice the price I would still recommend it for temp towing.
customer_reviews.author: susie q

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: New review: I was pleasantly surprised today to find this entire replacement for the trailer lights after the company made an inquiry and we realized there was a communication glitch! Very classy and appreciated!! Old review: Asked for a replacement for a light cover that fell off and tho they said they’d send one, I’ve not seen it! **Would recommend taping the seam where yellow and red light covers meet.
customer_reviews.author: ValGal

customer_reviews.title: Magnetic doesn’t hold driving on road
customer_reviews.text: As soon as we 30 mph the lenses fell off and the magnetic is not strong enough to stay in place. We had to tape it down. One of our lenses is gone and I can’t find a replacement. We complained to this company, they refunded our money immediately and they asked me to add this to the review. So here it is.
customer_reviews.author: Melyle

customer_reviews.title: There ok
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these because I just didn’t want to tap into the wiring on my Jeep. 1) the magnets seem weak. I have a steel flat top aftermarket bumper on my Jeep and can easily pull them off. 2) wired backwards. When I drove a tow truck years ago. You always ran the magnetic lights wiring down the drivers side of the vehicle so when you opened the drivers door the wiring was right in your face. You wouldn’t forget them. There are wired to run up the passenger side.3) wiring isn’t long enough I’ll have to make an extender
customer_reviews.author: eric

customer_reviews.title: Good, magnets could be a tad stronger...
customer_reviews.text: Works fine unless the wind is up, drivers side blew off on a stretch of 2 lane construction on the freeway with trucks blasting past. But for normal use it works just fine. They did not come loose on normal conditions road or wind. Work really well and are easy to hook up. I still recommend them but if you can throw a half hitch around the light when you are hooking it on to your rig and secure it to something it will be a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: John M. Barsness

customer_reviews.title: Lights Failed after ONE use
customer_reviews.text: The magnets are fine. The lights look good and everything appears to be quality. I checked my lights before leaving on a one hour trip and everything worked as it should. A few days later I was leaving and checked my lights. The left (drivers) side is completely dead. This is the only set of these I've ever owned. My grandfather had a set that he used FOR YEARS without issue. I had expected these to last more than an hour.
customer_reviews.author: YouKnowMyName

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Went install, when you put them on the sides so the wires that connect are in between the 2 lights and red is facing the outwards, the blinkers are then opposite then the car. So, we switched them so they match the trucks blinkers, and because they wire come from the outside of each light, they are now too short. We need them to use our boat this weekend so we don’t have time to return or fix the actual trailer lights. We are going to try and hang them upside down so they will reach. Hope they hold up for our 500 mile drive. Disappointing
customer_reviews.author: brittani

customer_reviews.title: Good Solution for Me
customer_reviews.text: I have a 4'X8' bed trailer that I mostly use for yard work. Over the years I have pretty much torn up the highway lights that came on the trailer. This is a good solution that on the rare occasion ( a few times a year) I need to take the trailer out on the highway. These lights can be quickly hooked up and then returned to safe storage when I complete my trip.
customer_reviews.author: James W.

customer_reviews.title: the price was cheaper than an auto electrician
customer_reviews.text: My utility trailer lights were victims of hungry rabbits, the cost of this product was cheaper than having an auto electrician rewire the lights. The magnet seems strong enough to handle every pot hole. The weak link in these lights, are the length of wire between the right and left. I will have to splice some wiring between the two to reach both sides of my trailer and have some slack. It would also be better if there was a connector between the two lights vs. hard wiring.
customer_reviews.author: Dac File

customer_reviews.title: Good for short trailers
customer_reviews.text: Much easier than rewiring your old trailer or for temporary use when using a tow-bar. My trailer has a 10 foot bed with 13 foot overall length. The lights work for my trailer but the wiring is too short for anything longer. Magnetic mounts are strong. Haven't had any problems with the lights falling off at highway speeds or rough roads (like the at the dump).
customer_reviews.author: The Wine Commonsewer

customer_reviews.title: Just annoyed at this point
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install and use. But one of the lights stopped working 2 days after the month timeframe was up that I could return them. And they were only used 2 times in that month, always kept inside when not in use. Customer service contacted me and sent me another set! Update: used the new set customer service sent me one time and the magnet fell off and the light flew off the trailer and broke 3 minutes after leaving the house. Attached a picture
customer_reviews.author: Mikayla Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Ok product
customer_reviews.text: Well first one ordered one light didn’t work. Sent back and received replacement, same issue. Maybe my wiring. Don’t have another vehicle to try it from. I kept this one as I had to use it. At least I had brake lights. Just one turn light would t work, on both sets.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Worked the first time but second time the left light stays on brake/bright. Checked the ground but both lights share the ground wire and the right side works ok. Buy something better than these cheapos
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Hold well work well, reverse the lenses
customer_reviews.text: Great to keep handy if trailer lights quit on the road at night. I tow different trailers related to my farm and this set up has helped a few times. The lenses are backward though, but they pop off easily and snap back on. They have an amber and a red lense and i wanted the red lense on the back with the wires coming out the top. The magnets hold on even on rough country roads.
customer_reviews.author: Donegal Shore

customer_reviews.title: so bad, in fact
customer_reviews.text: Boat trailer lights were gonzo, so bad, in fact, the hardware securing the lens crumbled. These are very handy replacements. Do not submerge. For a 20' boat on trailer you may need an extension to reach the tow light socket.
customer_reviews.author: Daral R. Makahusz

customer_reviews.title: Defective insulation
customer_reviews.text: Did not notice the defective insulation on the wiring until just before we were planning to leave.... had to go to the auto parts store and buy a much more expensive model. Needless to say, I'm not impressed with the quality. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: TW

customer_reviews.title: Magnets Too Weak
customer_reviews.text: I won't drive with these exposed to any road wind, because the magnets just aren't that strong (and the high profile lights above the magnets will likely be carried away). They work great (including both sides, so driver knows they're operating), but you have to find a secure and protected area to place them, else they are just not useful on the open highway.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Jones

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This has a really good strong magnet, not sure why some people are saying it doesn't. I drove 1,200 miles with these on a portable sawmill, with the last 100 of it over gravel and washboard roads, and they didn't budge. Rain and dust were no problem. I'll throw these in the truck anytime I tow a trailer from now on, just as a backup.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Installation is easy. Magnet only held on one side.
customer_reviews.text: I hooked this up to my painted steel trailer. One side (the one wired closest to the vehicle) stayed on securely. However, the second one kept falling off. Twice I was able to rescue it before it was damaged and reaffixed in a slightly different location. The third time, it bounced it's way down the highway and the casing came off and was significantly damaged. (Even with the bouncing/drag, the first light still stuck to the trailer.) So, I had to tape the parts back together and zip tie the light onto the trailer - which basically defeats the purpose of the magnetic option.
customer_reviews.author: Diane S

customer_reviews.title: Lasted a total of .... one mile!!!
customer_reviews.text: The magnets are still not strong enough. One fell off in the first mile and self destructed. The second fell off within ten miles. I was driving less than 45MPH over ordinary roads. Sent them back for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on truck bed extender
customer_reviews.text: I use a truck bed extender for hauling kayaks and these were perfect. I set them right on top of the extender. Just had to make sure the kayaks weren't moving at all b/c I can see how they'd get knocked off. But once in place, they didn't seem to move. We were on bumpy country roads and 75mph on the highway and no problem.
customer_reviews.author: ddbionic

customer_reviews.title: Great product and price
customer_reviews.text: For the price, these are excellent magnetic trailer lights. I use them when I had to tow dolly a car 300 miles. They stayed on the car using just the magnets at speeds up to 70 miles an hour without any problem for hours and hours. These are excellent for the person who occasionally needs a temporary set of tow lights!
customer_reviews.author: Spenserdad

customer_reviews.title: Good for the low cost
customer_reviews.text: They work but they are wired backwards than what you'd expect. The Right and Left are reversed so the line going to the towing vehicles hitch has to go diagonally through the towed vehicle. Also, one of the bulbs blew the first time it was used. They are cheap and easy to replace. Other than those things, the product worked fine for the low cost.
customer_reviews.author: D. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Magnets do not hold
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in November 2018 but I just used them today for the first time (May 2019). The magnets did not hold and fell off almost immediately. The lens broke and the lights stopped working. Update: The magnetics did not hold but they sent me replacement lights. The customer service is great.
customer_reviews.author: Karlee LaFountain

customer_reviews.title: Stay's On!
customer_reviews.text: I used the magnetic towing light kit when renting a big grill for a pig roast. The grill was built into a trailer but had no lights. I went 70mph on the turnpike and the lights stayed put. Worked great and I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amy C.

customer_reviews.title: Great value if handled correctly
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my tow vehicle behind my RV. They really STAY PUT. I haven't noticed any scratches on either of the cars I've used them on. Great value. Note, when installing or removing lights from vehicle grab them from the base NOT by the light.
customer_reviews.author: Ron, ILL

customer_reviews.title: Weak magnets. Buy something else.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Very easy to install. Cons: not especially bright, but worse they keep falling off. Until today, they only fallen off when stationary and we’re bumped. But today, one fell off while driving and smashed to bits. Now I have to buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Manxman

customer_reviews.title: Great set of tow lights for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I'm using these lights on a bike rack as the tires on my fat tire ebike somewhat obscure the taillights on my truck. The magnets hold well. Much less expensive than other lights I considered. Don't know why anyone would spend more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor lights
customer_reviews.text: Cheap they broke going on first trip. I returned and bought another set and they were awful as well
customer_reviews.author: Rocky

customer_reviews.title: GREAT  i use on daily basis!
customer_reviews.text: Work great im a tow truck driver so i use theese all day everyda6 magnets are strong and are made well.. Company also replaced a pair because of a minor durability issue A plus customer service
customer_reviews.author: Marshall FITZGERALD

customer_reviews.title: secure these to your trailer
customer_reviews.text: I just acquired these and was pleased with how they appeared to work. I used them for the first time today bringing a new boat home in Maine. I had them sitting on flat metal surfaces of the trailer and they felt real secure. however, after driving some twenty miles, we hit a rough stretch of road and apparently one popped off and dragged the other off. both were destroyed on road impact. I plan to acquire another set, but next time I will secure them with electrical tape or bungees! lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Magnet Is Weak
customer_reviews.text: Zero stars. The first weekend I used them on my utility trailer they fell off on the freeway. I ended up dragging them until i could get off the closest exit.
customer_reviews.author: Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Left turn signal does not work
customer_reviews.text: Only used one time and the left turn signal does not work. I have ordered 2 of these now with the same problem. Arizona did not refund the last lurches becaus I had waited to long, but same issue and only used one time.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Decent lights, not durable - Updated: Company responsive
customer_reviews.text: Worked well at first then became dimly lit. After about a dozen uses on short trips the light broke from the base. 11-27-2018 - The company sent a replacement. We have not used the replacement yet but the fact they sent a replacement after ours broke was helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Big T

customer_reviews.title: Great magnets
customer_reviews.text: I had to mount a pair of steel plates to my aluminum toolbox for the magnets to attach to but that is not the fault of the lights. The magnets are very strong and don't move at all now that I have a flat place to stick them.
customer_reviews.author: MMS

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this kit to use while towing home a trailer with bad wiring. Everything worked great, easy to install, easy to use. We just stuck them on the top of the bed sides and they stayed in place even at highway speeds for several hours. No issues at all. Might plan to bring some zip ties, the wiring is long.
customer_reviews.author: HillnTx

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last long
customer_reviews.text: Used these for a recent vacation trip. The good: The magnets are strong and didn't scratch the paint on our towed van and the cable was long enough to run from the back end of the van to the hitch point on the RV. The bad: They stopped working 600 miles into the trip.
customer_reviews.author: Skee

customer_reviews.title: Great product, price & magnets!
customer_reviews.text: These lights work great, they were easy to install and there were no issues with the magnets sticking. Drove down the highway for 20 miles with no concerns of them coming off.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Great option for our trailer that the lights were not working. Didn’t have time to find the short in the permanent lights so just threw these on & worked perfect. Great magnet hold. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Just completed a 1600 mile trip and it worked great. Speeds of 70 mph and the lights stayed put. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: John H.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, quick delivery.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived QUICK. Much cheaper than the auto parts store (likely the same product). The Forward facing amber lenses are great because you can tell the rear facing red lights are working.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two sided s magnetek lights
customer_reviews.text: It installed very early, but one of the turn signals didn’t work. I used a trailer to take something to the dump, and it didn’t have working lights.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Excellent all around
customer_reviews.text: I put them on the bumper of my travel trailer for added lighting at night while towing with my bike rack on back. They work great. Strong magnets.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Biagini

customer_reviews.title: Needs more wire length between lights!
customer_reviews.text: Just a bit short for the beam of the boat. Would rather have too much than too little!
customer_reviews.author: B. Bowman

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money, overheats
customer_reviews.text: Works well. However when being used for long periods of time one or both of them Just go out... perhaps it overheats. Still worth the value.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Bright and safe
customer_reviews.text: Used on box trailer until I could replace wiring in the trailer. Never had a problem even when driving in a torrential rain storm.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Great strong magnet, plenty of cord.
customer_reviews.text: The bulbs should be brighter, the magnet mount keeps it from moving. I would recommend this as a tow vehicle light set
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Jardin

customer_reviews.title: Just what  I hoped for.
customer_reviews.text: Strong magnetic attachment to my towed Suzuki's rear bumper. Bright lights easily seen in daylight.
customer_reviews.author: deaconrich

customer_reviews.title: Great Light Package
customer_reviews.text: This worked perfectly on my flatbed trailer. I used temporary zip strips to tether the long cord to the trailer while in transport and then cut them off once I was done. Great light package for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: DBartnik

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Plug them in and they work. Using them on a boat. Left blinky blinks, right blinky blinks.
customer_reviews.author: RMP

customer_reviews.title: Cover issues
customer_reviews.text: Update: I was contacted by the company and they asked me to give my contact info so they can resolve the problem. I will update again if the issue is resolved. I literally put the lights on monday, one of the red covers fell off on Wednesday. So other than that....
customer_reviews.author: Jason Morton

customer_reviews.title: Easy Peasy
customer_reviews.text: As Advertised. Easy hookup. One thing to note is that many new vehicles may have a towing plug but may need an adapter to plug in this trailer type connector. I just used the supplied crimps to crimp directly to my factory color coded wires and skipped buying the plug in adapter. Like I said "Easy Peasy"
customer_reviews.author: robert m

customer_reviews.title: Made for about 12’ trailer
customer_reviews.text: Cords are not long enough for 16’ car trailer, bought 6’ extension works perfectly then
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Bought them to use when carrying bikes ( covered) on my bike rack, have not used them yet, but plugged in and they worked, not sure if magnet will hold them on, but I will be re enforcing them with bungees Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Added safety for towing
customer_reviews.text: These lights hook up to my power adapter easily and the magnetic lights attach to towed vehicle without fear of scratching paint.
customer_reviews.author: Cyrus L Parsons

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use. Holds tight
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use. Magnets hold tight. Only thing was they are 4 pin so needed an adapter. Still worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Penny Sipes

customer_reviews.title: work well
customer_reviews.text: No complaints...work well and the magnet keeps them on at speed.
customer_reviews.author: Babadook

customer_reviews.title: Saved the day
customer_reviews.text: My 19ft flat trailer lights stopped working, so I put these on in minutes and was back on the road.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Milliken

customer_reviews.title: Held up well on the first trip
customer_reviews.text: Connected easily to power cords from van. Lights stayed securely attached to the pop-up bumper and operated perfectly for the first trip out and back.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly right out of the box! Only drawback is that the wire between the two lights is only 6 ft long and that makes it tough to get from side to side an a 5ft wide trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Deweydf

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I love these. They work perfectly! The price is great and they are easy to use/install.
customer_reviews.author: lrich152

customer_reviews.title: The magnet is not strong enough!
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be perfect for picking up my new (used) boat to be absolutely sure I’d have lights for my return trip home. The lights were dragging behind the boat about 50 miles into the trip. The concept is awesome and should work but it didn’t!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Peugh

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra few bucks
customer_reviews.text: Initially looked just like the $17 ones I bought previously that bounced off the trailer and broke less than a mile down the road - *BUT* I took my chances and bought them anyway because of feedback that says the magnets are stronger - This set stayed in place for the whole two-hour maiden voyage - well worth the extra few bucks!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use but one of the lenses fell out somewhere and they are impossible to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Frank L

customer_reviews.title: great product, AMAZING support
customer_reviews.text: Product is really good, but what separates it is the customer service. I had an issue that may have been caused by improper usage, and they stood behind it. Went far beyond my expectations. Thanks!!
customer_reviews.author: B Joiner

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: 20 Min into the trip the light fell off, magnet does not hold up very well, light broke completely and this was my first use of it. I do not recommend this product and if you do purchase it make sure you strap it down or zip tie don't rely on magnets to hold the lights in place.
customer_reviews.author: Juancarlos

customer_reviews.title: Good deal for the price
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well and will get you by in a pinch.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Fagen

customer_reviews.title: Works, but magnets are weak
customer_reviews.text: Magnets aren't as strong as they say but they work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very strong magnets and easy to work with.
customer_reviews.text: I use it on my trailer and works well. It has very strong magnets and it's nice to be able to place them where I need them to be.
customer_reviews.author: Spyder

customer_reviews.title: good lights
customer_reviews.text: they work great as extra lights on the boat trailer. Easy on and easy off.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN STRICKLIN

customer_reviews.title: Nice.
customer_reviews.text: Have worked perfect so far. Pro tip is to plug them in and see which one is left and right before you get too fancy routing them on the trailer.
customer_reviews.author: I. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Worked as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery. Easy install. Stayed put on decklid of car on dolly for 2500 miles even on rough roads you know which road.....I81 thru Scranton and Wilkes Barre...
customer_reviews.author: Timothy M. Remmers

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: These trailer lights saved me tons of money on a full rewire for our boat trailer. I feel soooo much safer now, esp on the freeway. I purchased the set back in May, a few weeks ago I noticed one of the caps came off, I contacted them and within a few days they sent me a brand new set--that's killer!!! Thank you CZC!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Thompson

customer_reviews.title: worked for me!
customer_reviews.text: nice complete set, plenty wide, stayed on ok but had it in front of spoiler. just made it to the u-haul extension point, you may wish for a longer length.
customer_reviews.author: neal fildes

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Put it on my trailer the day I got them and they work great
customer_reviews.author: arnold craddock

customer_reviews.title: Works great, magnet is strong, they stay on for smoothness, for bumps
customer_reviews.text: Works great, magnet is strong, they stay on for smoothness, for bumps
customer_reviews.author: Karim Helmy

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: unfortunately i had to return it because it came late, but looks like a great quality! Will defiantly consider next time i need it :)
customer_reviews.author: Alex L.

customer_reviews.title: Good lights
customer_reviews.text: Used a ton of these for my job trailer...differentprices different brands..these last longer than any others and waaaaay cheaper than ive found...i buy 2 sets still cheaper than autozone or walmart..buy em fool
customer_reviews.author: dave bewshey

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended
customer_reviews.text: Decided work as it was intended. No complaints. Would purchase again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne and Paige Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: The product is as described and a Good Value. It was easy to install and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Wire lenght was enough, fit perfectly. Recommend switching bilbs to led to make it brighter.
customer_reviews.author: Inzo

customer_reviews.title: Did the job.
customer_reviews.text: One light did not work. Bulb was broken. Magnets felt strong but did tip over had a steel wave runner trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: wiring a little short. Wire is cheap, better to have a few feet more than too little
customer_reviews.text: magnets are strong but must be placed properly. Wind at highway speed or a strong bump on trailer can dislodge them
customer_reviews.author: Morgul the friendly Drelb

customer_reviews.title: Terrible, dont waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Terrible fell off after ten minutes of driving. I was on normal roads not even bumpy and then just literally feel off. Like oh I give up.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Used for picking up a trailer with unknown wiring issues. Worked great for the drive home. For the money and peace of mind, can’t beat it
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: 7 Feet of Tail Light Separation, YES!
customer_reviews.text: Finally are pair of strong magnetic trailer lights that have more than enough cord to mount one light on each side of my fleetside pickup bed trailer!!! YES!
customer_reviews.author: Gospel Blues Lover

customer_reviews.title: Won’t stay on in rain.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the light set for my jon boat. First use one of the magnet failed in a rain storm and breaks a light off from the base. Lights now do not work. Spend the little extra and get a stronger magnetized product.
customer_reviews.author: Jay T

customer_reviews.title: lens cover fell off
customer_reviews.text: When hooked up to vehicle one light would flicker on and off after towing about 20miles lens cover fell off and this light no longer worked tried replacing bulb with no luck was hoping to get a replacement set or money refunded.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Kritzberger

customer_reviews.title: Product as described
customer_reviews.text: Got product on time. Works great with boat trailer. Will buy from seller again
customer_reviews.author: kelly w.

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but..
customer_reviews.text: A useful product to end the hassle of broken trailer tail-lights. Only problem is they're made in CCP.
customer_reviews.author: Denis Wang

customer_reviews.title: Not working.
customer_reviews.text: Turn Signal and break light not working. When I turn on my head lights they do work but that’s it. Maybe the seller can contact me with some help?
customer_reviews.author: Sam Ellis

customer_reviews.title: light cover fell off on first use
customer_reviews.text: Beware the light cover falls off really easy. I would suggest using tape before use or just buying a better quality product.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the money
customer_reviews.text: I used these as temporary lights when I removed my truck bed to work on the frame, they work well, but don't count on the magnets alone they aren't that strong, I tied mine down
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Not worth even looking at.
customer_reviews.text: Only one side worked. Won't recommend or buy again. I could have made better ones on my own. Next time I will.
customer_reviews.author: Shania Cheyanne

product_meta.title: CZC AUTO 12V Two Sided Magnetic Towing Light Kit for Trailer RV Boat Truck -Magnetic Strength 55 Pounds
feature_bullets: 55 pounds magnetic strength base will be holded so strongly to automobile metal surfaces ,so lights never fell off during working
Wire distance between lights is 7ft ，Wire harness length is 20ft enough with 4 standard pin connectors
Double sided 4 1/4" red brake light on front with amber flashers light at back
Ideal for towing applications up to 80” wide like,boat trailer truck RV,etc
Complies with DOT standards,Each kit have assembly and opearating Instructions for easy installing
